Description: Egyptian terracotta figure mask of philosopher or teacher. Bottom of beard missing. Two holes for fixing in to of head. Mould-made and open at back. White (gypsum?) coating with pink paint preserved in places over the skin. Dark brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis terracottas workshop that was operational from the3rd to the 2nd century BC. Mask of a teacher or philosopher. See similar masks NA523 and theatre masks also found in Naukratis (Bailey 2008, no.3566).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.310) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 96, nos 319-320)
